turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: If he hadn't found that Deputy job, I believe Buddy might've gone down the other path, got into some serious trouble. Settled him right down. That and your mother. 'Course he had that other one later.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Your mother wasn't one to get chased off her patch. Half the damn county knew and nobody thought the worse of her for seein' it through.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: The other one? Hell, at my age, every time you learn a new name you got to forget an old one. Your head's all crowded up--here it is--

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I sent your Daddy to the farm once.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: As I remember it was because he had a sassy mouth on him. Must run in the family--You wouldn't be runnin' numbers out of this club, now, would you, son?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Runnin' numbers without I know about it is both illegal and unhealthy. You remember that.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: How come you don't took familiar?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Houston, huh? I hear they let you boys run wild up there.

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAM
turns.text: He doesn't need to know all my business.

turns.speaker: YOUNG SAM
turns.text: So? What's he gonna do, arrest us?

turns.speaker: YOUNG PILAR
turns.text: It's supposed to be some big sin, even if you love each other.

turns.speaker: BELLBOY
turns.text: You haven't paid the cab.  He won't give us your bags 'til you pay him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Tell him he can keep them. The Bellboy looks puzzled.

turns.speaker: BELLBOY
turns.text: Have a nice evening, Mr. D'Amour.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I gotta be careful.  If Vinovich sees me talking to you.  He's an asshole, but he's a powerful asshole.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I've heard a name.  Someone they talk about in whispers.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I think maybe he taught Swann.  This is me.  See ya around.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm sure they'll have this place rigged.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I hear Mrs. Swann's quite a babe.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah.  She was killed in a car crash.  Her lawyer was driving. She was filing for divorce.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: My life was too weird for her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Billy?  This was on Miller's forehead.  Any idea what it is?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I could have lost my fucking hands.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That would have kept you out of the Magic Circle.  Which was presumably the idea.  These are about Nix.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I mean, there's no instructions--  What do you mean, they're not tricks?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What did Vinovich say? Something about walking a path between --

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Trickery and divinity.  Yeah, he says that all the time.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's because he knew.  He'd seen these files and knew.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm out of here, man!  Are you coming?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hey, anytime.  Actually, no.  This was enough.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: You don't have a clue what you're into, do you?

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: D'Amour... D'Amour... Why do I know that name?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I know him.  I saw him.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I saw him on T.V.  Some kid got possessed and he saved the little bastard's life.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: No.  He's just a guy who's got a nose for this shit.  Like you.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: I don't want him getting in the way.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: We've all of us waited too long to have the homecoming spoiled.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: What do you mean, "all of us?"

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: You didn't think it was just going to be you and me?  A lot of people believed in Nix. They haven't forgotten his promise.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: So tell me where Nix is buried.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: If you've lied to me to me --

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: I swear... this is the place Swann told me about.  The rocks...

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Jesus.  Valentin.  What did you do to your face?

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: Like the look of these?  I made them myself, to set him free.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Why did you wait so long?

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: I didn't have the skill to resurrect him.  I had to teach myself.  And that took time.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: And you think he'll be in a fit state to resurrect, after thirteen years?

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: If he was just a man like me, then no.  But he's not.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: Do you wish him to be amongst us?

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: Will you come to him on your knees?

turns.speaker: CULTISTS
turns.text: He's with us... He's with us...

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: Ever watched a man die?  If you watch very closely, you can sometimes see the soul escaping. And if you're very quick, you can catch it.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Please... Butterfield... I wasn't there.  Ask Pimm.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: Pimm's dead.  Jennifer Desiderio's disappeared.  They knew the Puritan was coming home.

turns.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
turns.text: So do you.  You've seen the future. Haven't you?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Please... I wasn't there... Ask Pimm.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I want you to help me help my husband.  I know he's in some kind of trouble.  And it's something to do with the man you saw murdered.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Yes.  They weren't close, but they saw each other once in a while.  I think Philip believes all that stuff with the tarot cards.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I think we make our own futures.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I don't exactly know. Philip doesn't like to talk about the past.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: We don't share our lives the way a lot of people do.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: We haven't slept in the same bed for years.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: But obviously you still care what happens to him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: We wouldn't be having this conversation if I didn't. Swann's one of the most remarkable men alive.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He's an illusionist.  It's not exactly brain surgery.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: No.  You're right.  He could have been something more. Maybe a lot more.  But people get lost.  Even good people. Too much fame.  Too much money,

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Will you take the job, Mr. D'Amour?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: That's not what I'm asking for. I want somebody who can find out what Philip saw in those damn cards. And stop it from happening.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: When do you want me to start?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Come to the show with me. Tonight I want you to see him with an audience.  They love him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I didn't marry him for love, Mr. D'Amour.  Tonight?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I heard what happened.  It looks like somebody murdered him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry I got into this too late. But if you want me to stick around, maybe dig where the cops don't look...

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I don't know where you'd start.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well... how about some of the other illusionists?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Yes.  I think you probably can.  We'd need to talk about your fee.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Forget the fee.  If I find Butterfield, maybe we'll talk about money.  If I don't...  ...my gamble.  Either way... I get to spend some time... here.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I went up to the Magic Castle. You were right.  He didn't have a lot of fans up there.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: He... didn't have me..  I told you-

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You didn't marry him for love.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So why did you marry him?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just curious.  Back to business.  Ever heard of a man called Nix?  Dorothea?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Yes... I'm here.  And no.  I don't know the name.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: It doesn't ring a bell.  I have to go.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Flesh is a trap.  That's what he used to say.  Flesh is a trap and magic sets us free.  Why did you come back?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I didn't leave.  I was just digging around.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jennifer Desiderio, for one.  She threw herself in front of a car this afternoon.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why don't you tell me the truth?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nix ran some kind of cult, right? Some kind of Charlie Manson deal?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: It was more than that, I think.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He was the real thing, right?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Swann said he could do stuff, yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: He could get into people's heads. Make them see things. Terrible things.  And he could levitate. Juggle fire.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He taught all this to Swann?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So Swann was performing magic. not illusions?  And what?  You thought he should be using it to cure cancer, not making millions.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Too much fame.  Yeah, I guess that'd turn anybody's head. Including yours.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You said you weren't with him for love.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I was grateful to him.  I owed him my life.  And he loved me. He couldn't always show it, but he felt it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He thought Nix was coming back, didn't he?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: No it isn't.  You can't help me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nothing's going to happen to you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't be.  Nix can't hurt you now.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I know.  I'm the one who shot him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: I was twelve.  Nix took me hostage, to get Swann to come to him.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: And Pimm and Swann.  Only Nix was ready for them.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Find Valentin!  Find him!  Get him in here!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's all right.  It's not hurting...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nix has got to have a weak spot. Everybody's got a fucking weak spot.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Crank call.  I'll get the number changed.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: It's better he's gone.  He would have done more harm than good.

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Harm to whom?  Me?  I don't think, so.  Try him again at the hotel.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Nix was never interested in you. It was always Swann.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: The usual.  Full house. Standing ovation.  I tell them it's magic...

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I'm putting in a new illusion tonight.  Will you be there?

turns.speaker: DOROTHEA
turns.text: Sure.  You want me to find out about Quaid?  I mean, the funeral?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: No.  I'm not going near him.

turns.speaker: EDDISON
turns.text: What were you doing up there?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm a private detective.  I was hired to follow somebody for a few days.  A guy called Tapert. Insurance fraud.

turns.speaker: EDDISON
turns.text: Tapert.  So, now I've got Tapert, Butterfield.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Tapert's got nothing to do with this.  He came here to get his palm read.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I got a file on him two inches thick.  He's a petty fraudster. This is something else.  Ever heard of someone called the Puritan?

turns.speaker: EDDISON
turns.text: New one on me.  Okay.  Let's see him.

turns.speaker: EDDISON
turns.text: After that fall?. He must have broken half his bones.

turns.speaker: EDDISON
turns.text: For now.  Are you planning to go back to New York?

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: I think we walk a narrow path, between... between...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Are you saying that sometimes the miracles are real?

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: No.  I'm saying they were always fake.  The saints, the messiahs, they were just illusionists.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So could you walk on water?

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: I could reproduce any miracle that's ever been performed, with a little preparation.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I heard he was the best.

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: If he was so good why's he so dead?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You tell me.  No?  I thought you'd maybe have a theory.

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: I'm not saying another word.  You damn fool.  He's a journalist.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just tell me about Swann.  Or are you too scared?

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: He was a freak.  Everything he did was tainted.

turns.speaker: VINOVICH
turns.text: Evil.  He was evil.  Come on.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Great accent, by the way.  Is it Brooklyn?

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: I need to speak to you, Mr. D'Amour.  About last night.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Whatever I said, I didn't mean it, okay?  I get a few drinks inside me --

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: I'm here to offer you a job.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm going back to New York in--  Shit!  I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Have you got a job that'll pay you five thousand a day?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nah.  You're driving it too carefully.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Somebody's been smoking in here for months.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Havanas.  You're not the smoker.  So who is?

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: You could almost pass for a detective, D'Amour.  I work for the best illusionist in the world.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I saw him in Vegas once.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: When I can afford to lose. Swann's quite a magician.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Never call him that.  He's strictly an illusionist.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Illusions are trickery. Magicians do it for real.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not a bad place.  Warm. Great view.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: I don't think the dead much care.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Looking for you.  I tried the hotel.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: You're a detective, with no clues. Where else are you going to look? I'm going to keep this brief.  Here's thirty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You didn't hire me.  She did. If she wants me off the job, I want to hear it from her.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: She doesn't want to see you. She's had enough pain.  Enough churning over the past.  She wants it all left alone.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Fuck regrettable!  I want to know why.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: What for?  You need to stay busy?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I like to know why things happen.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Why people die?  Give it up, D'Amour.  Go home.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I want to speak to Dorothea.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: You want more money, is that it?
